snippet.title: Beats Music (iOS)
snippet.description: We go hands-on with Beats' new premium music service, designed to appeal to people who want a more automated music listening experience.

snippet.title: Google Play Music for iOS
snippet.description: With a streaming library that won't fill up your iPhone storage in the free version, along with excellent music discovery options and ad-free radio with All Access, Google Play Music is a great option for audiophiles.

snippet.title: Music publishers fire DMCA take-down notices at top lyrics sites
snippet.description: The National Music Publishers' Association sent DMCA take-down notices to the biggest Web sites seeming to profit from posting unlicensed lyrics.

snippet.title: Google Play Music All Access
snippet.description: Google's music service received major updates revealed at the Google I/O conference that add new streaming options through its All Access service.

snippet.title: Beats Music to launch January 21, with AT&T as its front man
snippet.description: Jimmy Iovine's Spotify rival will be available to individual AT&T customers for $10 per month and to families for $15 per month, setting the fledgling service up with a big potential base of subscribers.

snippet.title: Archos aims for music lovers with the dualcore 40B Titanium
snippet.description: The Archos 40B Titanium may not have the most high-end features, but dual speakers promise a tuneful listening experience.

snippet.title: Xbox Music for Android
snippet.description: Xbox Music feels more like a first foray into music streaming rather than a finished product; it's functional, but it needs more features to compare with established apps like Spotify.

snippet.title: Xbox Music for iPhone
snippet.description: Xbox Music feels more like a first foray into music streaming rather than a finished product; it's functional, but it needs more features to compare with established apps like Spotify.

snippet.title: Spotify for Windows
snippet.description: With its enormous catalog of on-demand streaming music and its built-in social features for discovering new tunes, Spotify is an absolute must-have for audiophiles and casual listeners alike. But free users, beware of intermittent eardrum-piercing ads.
